title: Broadcom expected to get hit with EU antitrust order: report
text: Broadcom Inc. AVGO, +1.69% will be told by European regulators to suspend certain business practices this month, according to a report Friday. The European Commission is expected to issue an interim order to Broadcom to suspend practices including exclusive purchasing requirements with TV and modem makers, Reuters reported Friday. The order would remain in effect until the EU can determine if Broadcom's practices cause lasting harm to market competitors. Broadcom shares rose 1.7% to $279.08 in recent activity.
